title: Project Setup - Initialize a Source Directory

listitems.content: I have an empty html file and I need some boilerplate content for a frontend build system.

sections.title: A Hope
sections.subTitle: As a developer I'd like to...

listitems.content: Populate an HTML file with appropriate 'boilerplate' content for a frontend build system.

sections.title: A Practice
sections.subTitle: Here, some boilerplate content for an html file. There are great boilerplates that can be found across the world wide web. This includes bits that appear in several boilerplates.

listitems.title: Set the DocType
listitems.content: at the top of the file add a line `<!DOCTYPE html>`

listitems.title: Set the HTML element
listitems.content: Next, add an opening `<html>` tag. Make two line-breaks and add the closing `</html>` tag.

listitems.title: Begin Building the document head
listitems.content: Between the html tags, ad an opening `<head>` and closing `</head>` tags. Make an empty line between the head tags.

listitems.title: Fill the Head
contentlist: Add a charset declaration with `<meta charset='utf-8'/>`
Add a document title with `<title>Frontend Boilerplate</title>`
Add a document description with `<meta name='description' content='A Frontend boilerplate leveraging webpack, babel, and react.'>`
add a viewport declaration with `<meta name='viewport' content='width=device-width, initial-scale=1'/>`

listitems.title: Build and fill the body
contentlist: Build the Body with an opening and closing `<body>` and `</body>`. Include an empty line between the two elements.

Between the body tags, add 1 div with an id, using `
`. Here is where we will make react leverage the dom.
